about.name: Munich
about.info_text: Munich is a charming and culturally rich city located in southern Germany. Known for its Bavarian traditions, historic architecture, and beautiful parks, Munich offers a mix of old-world charm and modern sophistication. Visitors can explore the city's museums, beer gardens, and historic landmarks, or savor the delicious Bavarian cuisine that Munich is famous for. Whether you're interested in history, culture, or a bit of both, Munich has something to offer for everyone.
about.facts_text:
Population: 1.5 million
State: Bavaria
Time Zone: Central European Time (UTC+01:00)
Language: German
Currency: Euro (EUR)
about.climate_text: Munich has a continental climate with cold winters and warm summers. Average temperatures range from -1°C (30°F) in winter to 24°C (75°F) in summer. Munich enjoys plenty of sunshine, making it an ideal destination for outdoor activities during the summer.

attractions_card.title: Nymphenburg Palace
attractions_card.description: Nymphenburg Palace is a grand Baroque palace in Munich, known for its stunning architecture and beautiful gardens. Visitors can explore the palace's opulent rooms, art collections, and take leisurely walks in the palace gardens.

attractions_card.title: Marienplatz
attractions_card.description: Marienplatz is Munich's central square and a hub of activity. The square is surrounded by historic buildings, including the New Town Hall with its famous Glockenspiel. It's a great place to experience the city's atmosphere.

attractions_card.title: English Garden
attractions_card.description: The English Garden is one of the largest urban parks in the world and offers a peaceful escape in the heart of Munich. Visitors can enjoy serene lakes, walking and biking trails, and the famous Eisbach wave for surfing.

attractions_card.title: Hofbräuhaus
attractions_card.description: Hofbräuhaus is an iconic beer hall in Munich, known for its lively atmosphere, traditional Bavarian music, and, of course, beer. It's a must-visit to experience Bavarian culture.

food_card.title: Schnitzel
food_card.description: Schnitzel is a classic German dish consisting of breaded and fried meat, usually served with potatoes and a tasty sauce. Some of the best places to try schnitzel in Munich are at traditional Bavarian restaurants.

food_card.title: Bratwurst
food_card.description: Bratwurst is a German sausage made from pork, veal, or beef. You can find delicious bratwurst at local beer gardens and food stalls throughout Munich.

food_card.title: Pretzels
food_card.description: Pretzels are a beloved snack in Germany, and you'll find them at bakeries, street vendors, and beer gardens in Munich. They pair perfectly with beer.

hotels_card.title: Hotel Vier Jahreszeiten Kempinski
hotels_card.description: This luxurious hotel is located in the heart of Munich and offers elegant rooms, fine dining, and a spa. It's known for its impeccable service and central location.

hotels_card.title: Munich Marriott Hotel
hotels_card.description: The Munich Marriott Hotel provides comfortable accommodations and convenient access to the city's attractions. Guests can enjoy a fitness center, restaurant, and stylish rooms.

hotels_card.title: Aloft Munich
hotels_card.description: Aloft Munich is a trendy and modern hotel in Munich's city center. It offers vibrant rooms, a bar with a view, and a lively atmosphere.

transport_card.title: U-Bahn
transport_card.description: The U-Bahn is Munich's underground railway system, providing efficient transportation to various parts of the city. Tickets can be easily purchased at stations or through the mobile app.

transport_card.title: Tram
transport_card.description: Munich's tram system offers another convenient way to get around the city, particularly to neighborhoods not covered by the U-Bahn. Trams are a popular mode of transportation for both locals and tourists.
